item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Ibanez:

I just think Freeman’s mind should stay in Goldsrc and not move to BM. It just wouldn’t be as funny, I think. It would be far too much of a jump and honestly the best parts of Freeman’s Mind (and no they are not just occasional puns, it’s pretty constant) were when he would comment on the strange quirks of HL1 , like the AI and the level design. Stop being so patronizing.

Well, that is what you think. To me, level design puns are pretty minor.

This debate is useless anyway, seeing how it’s not us who is going to decide.

targ:

I made a video last month of scenes from the Episodes matched up with his voice, here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFqYO2Hbs-Q

That was fucking awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: targ
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

That’s not such a stupid idea when you put it like that.

Well that was the idea. Ross said he might do it for waking up after the blackout. Taking off or putting on glasses would be another good idea, if the scenes matched up well enough.

DansonDelta40:

I wonder what his comments would be on Half-Life 2 and the Episodes. I can imagine him drooling over Alyx, zooming in on her ass and stuff…

I made a video last month of scenes from the Episodes matched up with his voice, here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kFqYO2Hbs-Q

item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

Tentacles and Gargs are obviously realistic.

That’s not what I was referring to and you know it. :meh:

OldDirtyBastard:

You fail to see a refreshing shitload of possibilities to make shitloads of new puns when BM comes out.
And no, puns towards level design were only occasional. Plus after a couple of times, same puns all over again get boring.
You guys cannot see further than your nose.
BM is an opportunity for Mr. Scott to invent something new.

I just think Freeman’s mind should stay in Goldsrc and not move to BM. It just wouldn’t be as funny, I think. It would be far too much of a jump and honestly the best parts of Freeman’s Mind (and no they are not just occasional puns, it’s pretty constant) were when he would comment on the strange quirks of HL1 , like the AI and the level design. Stop being so patronizing.

Read full topic

item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Mostly the jump from the original goldsrc graphics with unrealistic level design (which is half of what makes Freeman’s mind funny) to hyper-realistic source graphics with nothing unrealistic to comment on, thus removing from the funny factor.

Tentacles and Gargs are obviously realistic. You fail to see a refreshing shitload of possibilities to make shitloads of new puns when BM comes out.
And no, puns towards level design were only occasional. Plus after a couple of times, same puns all over again get boring.
You guys cannot see further than your nose.
BM is an opportunity for Mr. Scott to invent something new.

Read full topic

item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
I also like Ross having Gordon do pullups. It adds much more realism into the whole story. Also that he avoids areas like the storage room in Office Complex. As a gamer, you’d definetly check it out, but as a scientist trying to reach the surface as fast as possible, you would give a shit about them. The same with HEV batteries and so on. I just like his realistic approach. Fun to watch how little sense the many things one undoubtedly does in the game make.

Read full topic

dude, look two posts above yours.

item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Sitten_duck:

Apparently he has been asked that several times before. He said that he doesn’t know if he will use Black Mesa, that he will see when the time comes.

I’ve heard rumors (probably from Mr. Scott himself) that, if he does use Black Mesa, he would probably do the switchover after Gordon gets knocked out and thrown in the garbage crusher.

Who knows?

For me, in particular, at first I was peeved that he had Gordon doing “pull ups” (getting into the ventilation shaft in the walk-in freezer and into the overhead walkway with the vending machine and such), but I figure, if he can take shortcuts and produce more and not get involved in the game-mechanics induced minutiae, let Gordon do all the pull-up-shortcuts he can!

Read full topic

item.description:
mr.FREEMANZ!!!!!!!!:

Hmmmm… I wonder if Ross Scott will use Black Mesa when it comes out, that would be kick ass

Apparently he has been asked that several times before. He said that he doesn’t know if he will use Black Mesa, that he will see when the time comes.

Read full topic

item.title: Freemans Mind
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
12th (or 13th to some) is out.
https://www.accursedfarms.com/News.php
Some excerpts from the FAQ

Q: Are you going to continue Freeman’s Mind all the way through Half-Life and Half-Life 2?

A: Maybe. Freeman’s Mind is sort of a runaway experiment that’s turned out more popular than I anticipated. There are projects I would prefer to work on instead, but nothing I could create in a similar timeframe. As long as there’s a continued interest in more episodes, I can’t see a reason not to make more of them. I just don’t want to promise I’ll complete the entire series in case people grow tired of it in the future.

Q: Will you switch over to Black Mesa for Freeman’s Mind once it comes out?

A: Maybe. I’m undecided, that might be a good transition for after Freeman blacks out.

Read full topic
